articles.description: Latest football news, including reaction to Nottingham Forest's points deduction and build-up to the women's Champions League.
articles.title: Football latest: Reaction to Nottingham Forest points deduction

articles.description: Real Madrid file a complaint against the referee who took charge of Saturday's game at Osasuna for not including allegations of racist abuse of Vinicius Jr in his match report.
articles.title: Real complain as referee omits abuse of Vinicius Jr

articles.description: Athletes' lives could be at risk if the Enhanced Games are allowed to go ahead, says Australian Sports Commission boss Kieren Perkins.
articles.title: 'Athletes' lives at risk at Enhanced Games'

articles.description: The UK government will establish an independent football regulator when the Football Governance Bill is introduced in Parliament on Tuesday.
articles.title: Bill introduced to establish football regulator

articles.description: Heather Knight's 63 from 39 balls set up a comfortable win for England in the first T20 against New Zealand.
articles.title: England beat New Zealand in T20 series opener

articles.description: BBC Sport's chief F1 writer Andrew Benson answers your questions as teams get ready for the Australian Grand Prix.
articles.title: F1 Q&A: Andrew Benson answers your questions before Australian GP

articles.description: Australia withdraw from their men's T20 series against Afghanistan in August because of continued restrictions on women and girls under the ruling Taliban in the country.
articles.title: Australia withdraw from Afghanistan T20 series

articles.description: Former Germany boss Hansi Flick is ready to return to management and will do so a changed man, says Guillem Balague.
articles.title: Barcelona or Premier League? Flick to return a changed man

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu withdraws from this week's Miami Open tournament with a reported lower back injury.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu withdraws from Miami Open with reported lower back injury

articles.description: Wales midfielder Ethan Ampadu will become the youngest Wales player to reach 50 caps if he faces Finland in Thursday's Euro 2024 play-off.
articles.title: Ampadu eyes date with destiny and history
